intro: Korthalsella opuntioides, commonly known as the desert cactus or false prickly pear, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spineless, flat, paddle-shaped stems that store water. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in the summer months, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Korthalsella opuntioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
